Line 137: Line 137:
Vincent Nguyen, from [[SlashGear]] noted the fast performance of Android 4.0.1, the tight integration between the operating system and the hardware and concluded that "this is the best Android phone around today".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.slashgear.com/galaxy-nexus-review-21196912/ |title=Galaxy Nexus Review |publisher=SlashGear |date=2006-10-27 |accessdate=2011-11-22}}</ref>
Vincent Nguyen, from [[SlashGear]] noted the fast performance of Android 4.0.1, the tight integration between the operating system and the hardware and concluded that "this is the best Android phone around today".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.slashgear.com/galaxy-nexus-review-21196912/ |title=Galaxy Nexus Review |publisher=SlashGear |date=2006-10-27 |accessdate=2011-11-22}}</ref>
  +   +
JR Raphael, from [[Computerworld]], stated "The Galaxy Nexus [...] is an exceptional phone, arguably the finest Android handset to date.", concluding "The Galaxy Nexus is sleek and attractive, with a thin, light body and a beautiful HD display. It's screamingly fast, too, delivering what may be the best overall performance of any mobile device available."
